project.name: OmegaTech PC Configurator
project.description: A multipage gaming-themed web application that allows users to build custom PC configurations by selecting components and viewing total costs in real time. The project should be lightweight, responsive, and visually polished with Bootstrap and jQuery slide animations. PHP will handle simple configuration saving to a text or JSON file (no database).

storage: Local JSON or TXT file (no database)

theme.style: Tech-themed, gaming aesthetic with dark background and neon accents (cyan, magenta, purple).
theme.font: Orbitron or Roboto Mono for headers, Open Sans for body text.
theme.animations: jQuery slide/fade effects for transitions and section reveals.

pages.name: Home
pages.content: Landing section with a hero banner (logo + tagline), short intro, and a 'Start Building' button that leads to configurator.php.

pages.name: Configurator
pages.content: Main builder interface. Users select CPU, GPU, RAM, Storage, PSU, and Case from dropdowns or cards. Display images, short descriptions, and real-time price updates. Include a summary section showing selected parts and total cost. Add a 'Save Configuration' button handled by PHP.

pages.name: About
pages.content: Simple page describing OmegaTechâ€™s purpose and future vision, styled with Bootstrap cards and gaming icons.

pages.name: Contact
pages.content: Basic contact form (name, email, message) validated via JavaScript and sent through PHP (dummy handling).

core: Real-time total price calculation as user selects components.
jQuery animations for section transitions and dropdown reveals.
Responsive Bootstrap grid layout with dark neon theme.
Save Configuration button triggers PHP script to write JSON to local file.
Simple contact form using PHP mail() placeholder logic.
optional: Button to download configuration as text or JSON.
Animated progress bar showing build completion percentage.
Neon glow hover effects on cards and buttons.

deployment.hosting: Local Apache/PHP server (e.g., XAMPP or Vercel with PHP support)
deployment.instructions: Place project folder in htdocs and access via localhost/buildmypc.
